column4: How can i check for error messages at startup ? - I havnt been able to read the full message.
check the logs and dmesg; but many messages from the init system may get lost
so what you mean use dmesg and grep or something i know it said couldt not find /lib something rest i cant remember
dmesg is only for kernel messages. try /var/log/syslog /var/log/daemon.log etc.
right click n the terminal window.
there is no options for that ><
do you know if madwifi has been removed ? found a guide to my wifi drivers but cant download it from there ?
b43 does not work for you ?
well i got a ASUS K70IO that has issues with the WLAN making it so i cant restart my computer, it just freezes with a black screen
after 3 days of googling i figured it was my WLAN
computer shutsdown normal but if i use restart or reboot or halt it just freezes after "system now rebooting"
sorry i do not see how the wifi can be interfering in shutdown process ...
well what is wierd is that i can do a clean shutdown but i cant reboot ><
